info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 26 at 9:52PM EDT until October 26 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Melbourne FL
info.description:
FFWMLB
The National Weather Service in Melbourne has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Brevard County in east central Florida...
* Until 1145 PM EDT.
* At 952 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 7 and 12 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rockledge, Cocoa, Cocoa Beach, Cape Canaveral, Sharpes, Port Saint John, Port Canaveral, Merritt Island, Jetty Park, Canaveral Groves, Merritt Island Wildlife Refuge and Bellwood.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 11:45 PM EDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 11:45 PM EDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 11:45 PM EDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 11:45 PM EDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
